name: Athis: A Debt With Teeth
description: Athis has kept a secret since before Jorrvaskr: an old debt to a Dunmer house contact who is now in Whiterun asking to collect. The debt is not gold — it is a name. A witness. And giving it means endangering a current Companion. Athis needs Elitrof to help him find a third path before someone gets hurt — or before the Hall's trust in him collapses.

objectives.description: Learn the nature of Athis's old debt: a Dunmer house contact needs testimony against a Companion associate in a Windhelm trade dispute. Athis refuses to give it without knowing the consequences.
Investigate the Windhelm dispute independently to determine if the house contact's claim is legitimate or a manipulation; gather enough information to advise Athis honestly.
Help Athis resolve the debt on his own terms — either by brokering a settlement, providing alternative evidence, or confronting the contact directly. The choice must be Athis's.

items: Dunmeri Oath-Seal (flavor; aspect: 'Debt Settled, Oath Intact')

reputation.reason: Helped him resolve a past obligation without betraying the Hall.
Preserved internal trust and demonstrated Hall solidarity across racial lines.

rewards.notes: Loyalty increase of +10 unlocks Athis's romance gate (requires loyalty >= 85).

complications.trigger: Aela suspects the Dunmer contact is a spy and will push to expel Athis preemptively if the situation becomes public — Elitrof must manage information carefully.
Njada will use any hint of Athis's past to question whether outsiders can truly hold Hall oaths — the ideological friction with the Purity Path makes this explosive.

consequences.success: Athis resolves his past debt without compromising the Hall or himself. His loyalty to Jorrvaskr deepens — he now believes 'home' can survive a crisis. His loyalty increases and he becomes a trusted bridge to outsider communities.
consequences.failure: The debt is called in publicly, creating a scandal inside the Hall. Athis's standing suffers and his loyalty does not increase. The Dunmer contact becomes an ongoing problem.

gm_notes: Athis's bond quest is about belonging under pressure. The emotional core is the moment he realizes Elitrof investigated on his behalf without being asked — because that's what shield-siblings do. Keep the Dunmer contact morally ambiguous: they're not a villain. The 'third path' resolution should feel earned, not easy. Tie the Windhelm thread loosely to the civil war arc if desired.
